Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Courtyard Marriot on a weekend stay in Seattle. It was a cozy hotel with all amenities (including free Wi-Fi). The Hotel was conveniently located 1 block from the Light Rail so it was easy access from the ariport. It was also conveniently located next to Pioneer Square and not far from Park Place Market. We had a view of the Bay on the 14 floor which was great and we were lucky to be in Seattle when it was sunny. The Bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: ProMetalSales
Reviews.Content: I live in the Seattle area but stayed here as a staging point for a medical treatment the next day. Being a long time Marriott & Courtyard fan I found myself rather disappointed in this property. First I am always offended at having to pay a parking charge at a hotel, perhaps justifiable in some major cities but not $28 for Seattle. The heavy light blocking curtain, certainly needed, did jammed halfway across one of the windows and let in light all night. There was a strange annoying noise that repeated outside the window. No hotel or TV channel info was to be found. I normally would not eat dinner in a place like this but elected to for convenience. The "dining room" ambiance left a lot to be desired, food good, prices a bit steep considering the number of high quality eateries close by. On the plus side, great friendly service and they paid attention to my "special requests" which I always appreciate. The location is excellent if you are from out of town for a ballgame, concert or show in the SODO district as well as close to a host of great restaurants. You could walk back safely from many venues at night if you stick to the main roads to the hotel saving more parking fees. Overall I did not think this stood up to the Marriott standards and they have had a year to get it right. I might look at some of the other hotels in the area as well, unless you are a loyal brand customer in which case check out your room for quality before unpacking!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MapMinder
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here this past weekend. The hotel staff were life savers, after I discovered I had a senior moment and didn't actually book the room for the night. Despite being fully booked, they got us in. Room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The bed comfortable with lots of pillows. Nice - the heat is easily adjusted in half degrees, so got it just right. The Pioneer Square light rail station is 1 block away, which can take you right out to SeaTac. The Amtrak station is about a short 3 or 4 block walk away, Pioneer Square is just a couple blocks away, and we even hoofed it up to Pike's Market a couple of times, which was a great, although fresh walk. So this hotel is very convenient. We didn't have a bay view, but our view wasn't bad. The hotel was full of sports fans, but we didn't hear anything from our room, all was quiet. Could hear sirens, but otherwise quiet. The shower was nice & easy to use. No fan in the bathroom, but it wasn't a biggie. In the lobby they have a few computers to use, plus free coffee. They also had a pool, fitness room, and guest laundry facilities, though we didn't use any on this trip. Our free breakfast was in the 'The Bistro', cafe for the hotel and it was modern & clean. Limited menu - we had toasted bagels, fresh fruit cup (filled up a bowl), and great vanilla yogurt parfait with tasty granola & fresh strawberries. What really makes this hotel shine is the people - all were just terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations for parties. Wonderful staffs.”
Reviews.Author: AlyxisPaige
Reviews.Content: Stayed here multiple times when I go to the clubs near Pioneer Square. Walking distance to the Last Supper, Trinity, etc... The latest stay was St. Patrick's Day 2012. The room I got are always spotless and clean. Beds, linen and blankets are always super comfy. After check in, we called down and asked for extra linens for the fold out sofa. Within 10 minutes, it was brought up. Any room services I ever use were fast and all the staffs were very friendly. Also, I left my iPad2 at the hotel this last stay. I called after I was already 3 hours away from the hotel and the front desk told me that the housekeeper (whose name I later learn was Josephine) has just turned it in and it was locked away in one of their safety deposit boxes. I told them I couldn't come back to Seattle again until the following Friday, and they agreed to hold it for me until then. When I arrived to pick up my iPad, there was not a scratch on it. I can't even begin to express my appreciation for the integrity shown by the staff here! Two small concerns: 1) valet usually takes a long time to retrieve the vehicle -- so call at least 15 minutes before departing your room. 2) location is perfect for the pioneer square. It is too far walk if your main interests are shopping, pike place market, or city center (space needle) -- unless you want to pay for taxi or take your car, I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Still new and excellent for business use”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: This was my default hotel for business stays last year. It emerged from a recent renovation as a very clean, comfortable modern hotel. Numerous electrical outlets, fast free Internet access and a nicely appointed bar/grill. The staff is excellent and the location is close to many after work diversions. The only reason I scored it a 3 for location is the proximity of the various shelters that results in a constant stream of junkies at night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, old building with cosmetic updating”
Reviews.Author: Arcadia_R
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard sits in the midst of a group of office buildings downtown, and has had cosmetic renovations and interior updating but the overall structure, including the windows, is still old. My king room was small but very clean, much cleaner than the average Courtyard. Noise levels were worse than average. First, the windows are single paned glass with the old wood frames that don't shut tightly. I was on the 4th floor facing Cherry Street and the traffic noise was significant. (Somehow they ignored my Gold rewards profile request for a quiet room on a high floor.) Walls are thin and room to room noise was poor as well. Even with my room fan on high, I could hear my neighbor talking, and his phone alarm going off in the morning. Rooms on Cherry Street face a tall office building across the street. During working hours, people in the offices can see directly into the hotel rooms. No privacy at all. Or views. Or natural light. Breakfast in the hotel's Bistro restaurant was good and reasonably priced, but it wasn't open when I arrived at 11 pm the night before. There didn't seem to be much in the way of restaurants or night life close by. Overall, it was about average for an in-city mid level business hotel, but I doubt I would stay here for a romantic weekend or family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MyrtletheTurtle
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed a recent postponed Valentines Day weekend in Seattle. Our stay at the Marriott Courtyard Pioneer Square was just what we had hoped for; nice hotel, clean and comfortable king sized bedroom, great location, friendly and informative staff, reasonably priced..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: cdhinhou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Seattle Downtown on February 3rd and 4th, 2012. The room I booked had a king sized bed, and was clean and quite spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable and the mattress felt brand new. The hotel is located near Pioneer Square and is ideally located to walk to the waterfront, Pike Place Market, the aquarium, and even the Space Needle and monorail. The onsite valet parking is a tad expensive at $28 a day, but this is really to be expected since parking in at a premium in downtown Seattle. Besides, at $129 a night for a large room with a king sized bed, I can hardly complain about the price of the parking. I will definitely stay here again when visiting Seattle in the future.

Reviews.Title: “An Upscale Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Jeh922
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels which were carved out of existing older buildings an have been disappointed but the Pioneer Square Courtyard did not diappoint but wowed me. Every aspect is updated and new. It was a pleasure to stay here and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Access to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gorge-trekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights back in April 2011 for a wedding to take place down on a cruise boat. The building had that old time elegance and the staff was very professional and friendly. I had forgotten my dress in the car and the attendents quickly got our vehicle (parking is off site) so that we could make it to the wedding on time. This is a great location to take advantage of all the sights. We walked down to Pike's Market and saw the flying fish and had coffee at the original Starbucks. The next day we walked over to the monorail and went out to the Space Needle and ended up walking all the way back enjoying the wonderful architecture. We walked to the docks for the big event. Though the room was not large it was fine for the four of us since we spent most of our time sight seeing. We had room 607 which looked out onto the street ~ not picturesque but since we are from a rural area we enjoyed "the city view". Really appreciated having the refrigerator and small coffee pot that got our mornings started and appetizers before going out to dinner. I thought it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Pioneer Square”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheMoon
Reviews.Content: This is a newly remodeled historic building in Seattle’s Pioneer Square area and would be a great choice for those going to events at CenturyLink Field, Safeco Field, or the WaMu theater, as well as those who will be moving through Seattle’s cruise terminal (Argosy, Victoria Clipper, or regular cruise ships.) The hotel is an easy walk to each of these, as well as some great neighborhood bars and restaurants. The remodel was tastefully done, and the addition to the rear of the building for newer rooms was also done appropriately for a historic building. The basement features a nice pool, but note that there is not a lot of lounge space around the pool so its best used for a workout rather than a “hangout” spot. The exercise room is huge and impressively equipped. I had a King room with the “Bay view” which was on the tenth floor, putting me just high enough to see the water over the building across the street. The views are impressive and certainly worth an upgrade. While the room is not large it is intelligently designed with furniture whose flexibility allows you to make it what you need – a desk that can be pulled out and moved if you need a larger table, a small ottoman that works both as a table and seating space, etc. It was very well done. The bathroom was large enough to feel spacious without sacrificing square footage in the room itself. We had no problems with noise, even given that it was New Years Eve when we stayed. My only real complaints about the room were trivial – rather than properly strip the woodwork and repaint they saved money by just repainting on top of the old (which I suppose is better than ripping out the original features entirely!) There was also a long hair left on the side of our tub which grosses me out more than it probably should, but there you go. The hotel had friendly service, and is firmly in the 21st century with convenient electronic terminals set up for guests in the lobby to print boarding passes, valet service that takes a text message when you need to order your car, and free wi-fi that worked very well. I can’t remember what we paid for valet, but given the dearth of available parking in downtown Seattle I found the fee worth the unlimited access to my car. We didn’t try breakfast, but enjoyed a late night snack at the comfortable bar while watching the world go by out the floor-to-ceiling windows on the street. All in all this is a great option for the Pioneer Square area, especially if you are a Marriott member or prefer familiar corporate chains (and their lower prices) to the smaller boutique options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Large and stylish king room”
Reviews.Author: Orange-Boven
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Large stylish bedrooms. Pool very small, kids enjoyed the gym! Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this Value in any City!”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in as many years. I gave it 4 stars the first time but decided to bump it up for this review. I've been here over Thanksgiving both times and have enjoyed this hotel thoroughly. It is easily accessible to all local transportation options, which are extensive in seattle, so no car needed! It's a cool urban hotel with the new courtyard design. Surrounded by many local establishments. Easy walk down to the pier and Ferry terminals. The light rail to/from the airport is 2 blocks away. I can't think of anything they did not take care of, from early/late check in, to loaner umbrellas. I can't think of a better value in any of the major cities that I travel to.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Seattle Hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: sleibson
Reviews.Content: Seattle's center may have moved but Pioneer Square is where it all started and Marriott has placed a new hotel square in the heart of the old city. This is a 15-story hotel, so it's not typical of a suburban Marriott Courtyard but it uses the urban model of a high rise, limited amenity hotel. The location is terrific. It's a block from Pioneer Square and a block from a light-rail stop that takes you to/from Sea-Tac Airport in 37 minutes for $2.75. The staff is terrific. I cannot recall a more engaged, friendlier staff at any Marriott property I've ever patronized. The rooms are pretty good. This hotel has been installed in a former office building called the Alaska Building and some of the old building shows through in the lobby where you can see mid-20th century marble and the old-style, multi-story mail chute dropping into a large brass mailbox in the lobby. You'll also see some of the old buildings in the windows, which use the old casings equipped with new double glazing. Our very large room had a terrific view of Seattle's sourthern downtown. Two flys in the ointment for us: 1. The room chair (an adjustable desk chair) was uncomfortable due to its design. This is the first such chair I've encountered at a Marriott Courtyard and I hope it's not the new "official" desk chair. 2. The credit-card room keys just didn't work well and we had a second set made (done cheerfully, of course). We had to try 3, 4, or six times before the door would open. We had similar problems with using the key in the elevator to access our floor from the lobby (a good security feature in any case). From this hotel, we walked to the ferry terminal for an inexpensive ride to Bainbridge Island (free return!), to the famous Pike Market to see fish tossed around by loud fishmongers, to the Underground Seattle tour (highly recommended), and to the light rail stop for a return to the airport. This area is well served by the Seattle mass transit system. The hotel has a restaurant and bar called The Bistro and we ate three meals there. Frankly, the food was good twice and mediocre once but the service was always spectacular. Note that this restaurant has a somewhat limited menu (hence the name), but you should be able to find something to dull your hunger. They serve Starbuck's coffee, in case you're an addict. Otherwise, there's a Seattle's Best coffee shop across the street. There was a ballroom located on our floor (14th) and we snuck in to take a peek. It was set up conference style and could accommodate about 50 people at tables set up in a chevron pattern. I'd certainly locate a conference there given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: benfbrown
Reviews.Content: Despite having an excellent stay in another property the last time we were in Seattle, we decided to stay here this time around. For >$100 per night less, we had a similar sized room (1 BR, 650 Sq, Ft) that was every bit as nice. Granted, the bathroom in this hotel isn't as nice as the other property but the hotel does feel almost (but not quite) as upscale. As another reviewer mentioned, this property seems more like a Renessaince than a Courtyard. The hotel is located in the Pioneer Square District which could be viewed as a strength (proximity to tours, market, etc) and a weakness (number of homeless in the area). As someone else noted, the windows in the rooms do not seem to be the type that reduce noise and we did have a lot of street noise even though we were on the 12th floor. This doesn't really bother us but if you are the type who needs quiet when you sleep, you should be aware of this issue. All in all, we thought this hotel was a good, solid choice. When price is considered, we thought it was a bargain for Seattle and we don't regret our decision to stay there in the least. One other tip: As others have said, do use the Link light rail to get here as the Pioneer Square Station is literally a block away and the cost is less than $3.00 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: cable_consultant
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business. The location is only 1 block from the Light Link Rail - Pioneer Square stop, so it was exceedingly easy to get to from the airport. And since I was visiting a company only 2 blocks away, there was no need for me to rent a car. The hotel was in excellent condition, perhaps recently remodeled? I asked for a high floor, but was told that the rooms up high were smaller, and they recommended a lower floor. I believe I ended up on the 4th floor. The room was great - it reminded me of a modern room I stayed at once in Tokyo. And it was very clean. It was fairly quiet from within the hotel, although I did hear a siren or two outside. The fitness center was great! It was fairly large, had a number of treadmills, a couple bikes, and a couple ellipticals, along with weights. Everything was in great shape, and it included towels and wipes for the machines. The pool appeared to be a typical hotel pool - nothing you'd attempt to do laps in. There's a restaurant in the hotel where you can buy breakfast (and lunch & dinner, I believe). The breakfast was delicious and reasonably healthy, but I thought it was expensive. Regarding the downtown, it seemed like most of the restaurants closed early, leaving only the more fancy places open for dinner. I did, however, locate a Thai place about a block away (to the south), and an Indian place about 10 blocks away (to the north), both reasonably priced for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Renaissance than a typical Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a restored historic building next to Pioneer Square in downtown Seattle. Perfectly located, the hotel is certainly not your typical Courtyard. Except for things like room service and concierge service...the hotel was similar to a Renaissance property. The staff were excellent....each one....from front desk, valet parking, housekeeping..... I had a corner room with a view of the waterfront, Pioneer Square and the Stadium (with a perfect view of the fireworks). High speed Internet was both fast and free. Rooms were very modern and tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Stadium”
Reviews.Author: 154914AlbertaBound
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the proximity to the Stadium, The hotel itself is very interesting (an old bank), but our room was quite small. The bed was comfortable (bedding was wrinkled - looked slept in), but we had NO view. We were on the second floor looking out onto the roof of the main floor and surrounded by tall brick buildings which meant the room was always dark. The most disconcerting thing for us was the filthy glass that I removed from the plastic wrap with a sticker prominently claiming "sparkling clean". We handed this to the front desk at checkout, and frankly I don't think she took it seriously enough. I ate breakfast in the Bistro and it was fine. Wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “2 of us plus a 11 month old”
Reviews.Author: KLK111
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and this location was just a few blocks away. Beautiful and clean interior with old character of the building. Recommend using the "BestParking" app for your iPhone to locate parking spots in the area (see photos), as meter parking rates fluctuate throughout the day. (Valet is about $34 after tax, for 24 hours, in/out privileges) We upgraded to the breakfast for an extra $20 per night. The value of our breakfast was more than that for the mornings we were there. (free breakfast for children) Not the best quality of food as we had the breakfast plate and sandwich, but had the French toast the 2nd morning which was tastier. We had the King Suite and had they provided the Pack-n-go crib. No problem with noise from the street. Large bathroom space. Coffee in the room wasn't very good but they have Starbucks coffee from their bistro downstairs anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in early December 2011. My main reason for booking this hotel was its proximity to the football stadium. I was arriving in the afternoon for a 5:30pm game and wanted somewhere close so I wouldn't have to worry about getting to/from the game after a cross-continent flight that day. Rooms: A little on the small side, but nothing to complain about. There was limited closet space and very little space to walk around the room. There was a small sofa which was rather uncomfortable to sit on for any time. Good HDTV on a swivel so you could watch it from the bed or the sofa. My room was on the 7th floor overlooking 2nd Ave. It was quite noisy with sirens and buses outside. I'd recommend trying to find a room not facing that street. Overall, the room was a pretty standard Courtyard room (which is a good thing). One thing I found very unfortunate was the level of soundproofing between rooms. You could listen in on normal conversations in the rooms on either side. It made getting to sleep a bit difficult one evening through no fault of the people in the other room. Amenities: Excellent fast and free wi-fi. Free papers available each day. There was a small selection of snacks and beverages for sale by the reception desk. I did not have a chance to try any food or drink from the onsite bar/cafe. Location: This could be a strength or weakness depending on what you're planning to do in Seattle. For a football, soccer or baseball game, it's outstanding (10-15 minute walk to the stadiums). If you plan to use light rail/buses to get around Seattle, it's about a block and a half walk to the Pioneer Square transit station. If you're walking to Pike Place or that area, it's about a 10-15 minute walk. In the evenings, the area right around the hotel is pretty dead. I would have preferred a place with a bit more evening activity in the area (but made the conscious decision to stay here to make travel to the football game easier). The area right around the hotel is a bit rough in places (especially heading south). I didn't feel unsafe, but did walk with purpose and pace in this neighbourhood. Staff: Absolutely incredible. Everyone was so very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “They took care of us”
Reviews.Author: Baldgreybeard
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were above average, especially for the price. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was super. The valet parking was convenient, but pricey. Nice job overall, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Raidersh8ter
Reviews.Content: Prob one of the most convienent hotels Ive stayed at as my journey to see all NFL stadiums. I was able to take the light rail from the airport to an exit near this hotel with a very short walk that cost a few dollars compared to a cab or airport shuttle or rental. This hotel was a quick walk to Qwest Field, Pioneer Square, and waterfront and Pikes Market.. I wish the rooms were a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and friendly. Room was on the 13th floor. Rooms are quite small, but accommodate a large king bed, chair, and desk. The bathroom was large and very clean. Since this is an old remodeled building the hallways are quite wide. Nice flat screen TV with many channels, and free wifi. The weekend I stayed the hotel was very busy and yet there was little to no noise from the outside into the room. Lobby is nice, there is also a restaurant attached to the property and there is a small mini market located in the lobby for purchasing of snacks etc. There is also a business center, swimming pool and fitness center. The hotel is located about 5 minutes away from the Seattle Metro Transit Tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gut73raf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 night for a conference. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room large and comfortable. I will stay in this hotel again. The restaurant/bar had good food. The gym was a good size with enough equipment to keep you busy for a while. I stayed on the 14th floor in a room with a small kitchen, never used it but it was cool to have it. All in all a good hotel about 1 mile from Pike street.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the historic district and the Seahawks”
Reviews.Author: wheath4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay to visit the historic district (Pioneer Square) in Seattle or go to a ball game. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The moment you drive up the valets are right there to assist. There is only valet parking at $28 per night. The historic district and the Mariners and Seahawks stadiums are well within walking distance. The rooms are well appointed and large. A gem in the middle of town.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unknowledable staff make the stay a poor experience”
Reviews.Author: eccewbd
Reviews.Content: From the very moment of arival, Front desk staff were most all rude and to busy with their own personal conversations to assist customers. As a Platinum Marriott Rewards member I received no special treatment and was assigned to a standard room. Because of the design you could not even watch TV from the bed but had to use the only chair in the room to do so...terribale design. I immediately called down and had to threaten to move to another hotel to actually receive a room where I could watch TV from the bed. Looking back I should have moved to the Renaissance as, for the same rate, it included a suite upgrade, club lounge with free breakfast and Hors d'oeuvres. NOTHING at your hotel, not even the offer of a late checkout, no free drink, no beakfast. Staff was also incompetent as I received 3 or 4 different directions to places from different people - the next contradicting the others. I think most hotels have printed directions to major sites (the Space Needle or Chiantown) or restaurants. They offered only their individual routes which got us lost each and every time! That combined with cheap worn towels, waiting 3 hours for some extra pillows 2 different nights and rude staff at the front desk. So much for corporate loyalty. Don't expect to be treated to anything by attitude here and you wll get plenty of that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: railfanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed At this hotel with A friend. Its very nice Very close to the King street Amtrak Station which is a Plus for me. The Front desk staff were Nice and very helpful. The bistro Staff were OK and the Food was good. We Chose the Breakfast Included Rate. The rooms were clean Nice comfy beds. The WI-FI worked great and was able to upload videos to YouTube. I would suggest this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Game”
Reviews.Author: ScottLockwood
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Seattle for the Sounders game Oct 15. It was the last regular season game for retiring goalkeeper Casey Keller and we expected a big crowd (64, 160). We cam e by train and the hotel is an easy 3 block walk from the station and about 44 to the Century Link Stadium. It is a grand old office buiolding (the Alaska Building) that has been tastefully converted to a fine hotel. The rooms are spacious, modern and the beds were very comfy. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. There is valet parking at about $28 but since we had no car that didn't matter much. Easy walk to the warf and the Public Market. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting Downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: azsunbaby
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip to Seattle. The location of this hotel is perfect! You are within walking distance of the baseball and football stadiums as well as the water, pikes place market and Westlake Shopping Center. If you don't want to walk you can also take the Light Rail. We took the light rail from the airport to the hotel. It was $5.50 total for 2 people. It dropped us off 1 block from our hotel and was perfect. The lobby is easy to get in and out and doesn't feel like most hotel lobby's. It has a touch screen large TV attached to the wall that you can use to help find info on shopping, dining etc . Every employee that we encountered was friendly and helpful. We even received a call from the Manager asking us if the charges from the Restaurant were indeed ours as they thought it was fraudulent. Now that never happens! The room we stayed in was a bit on the small side but I think that is only because we used our Marriott points to book it. Having said that the bathroom was large which I LOVED and the windows opened slightly so you could let the fresh air in. Their TV's in the room let you pull up your folio at any time and check your balance. The wifi was free and easy to access with good speeds. The restaurant has happy hour so we went downstairs and had a few apps and drinks. They were priced well and tasted very good. We also used the workout room which has plenty of machines with personal TV's. We didn't use the pool but it looked OK however I never did see the hot tub. We were going to the Seahawks game so this location was a perfect for us as we could walk straight to the game and not worry about a cab. We will be back in Seattle again and we will absolutely stay here. One bit of advice I would give.... If you can try and take the light rail or cabs I would. Avoid a rental call if at all possible because parking in downtown Seattle is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quality Property, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the southern end of Downtown Seattle. If you are arriving, via AMTRAK, this is the property for you. A short 5min walk from King Street Union Station to the property. Also, both SAFECO Field and the Seahawk Stadium are a short walking distance from the property. ROOMS: I had a King Rm, 10th FLR, view of Cherry St. Typical room size for a Downtown Hotel in a large city. Bed extremely comfortable, and bathroom very roomy. FACILITIES: Pool and fitness center were very nice (in the basement). Self-serve laundry also in the basement. Breakfast is not included----as there are several options nearby (but, there is also a eatery in the Hotel). NEARBY: One block east, at the corner of Cherry and 4th St, is the Columbia Tower (x-Bank of America BLDG). For $5 bucks, you get access to the Observation Deck---on the 73rd floor---which is higher than the Space Needle....and, MUCH cheaper. I had the entire deck to myself when I visited. Views are spectacular (as long as the weather cooperates). Tower is less than 5min from the Hotel.....much closer/cheaper/less crowded than Space Needle. Pacific Palace shopping on Pike St is a 7-10min walk (mind you, some of the streets are STEEP). Ferry terminal is 2 blocks west of Hotel.....less than a 5min walk. STAFF: All the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. Brittney on the evening staff was helpful in arranging a late check-out and offered to hold my luggage behind the desk, no charge, until later in the afternoon when my train departed (very nice of her). Overall, this property made my 2 day visit to Seattle very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here!”
Reviews.Author: thefoodlover1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with three colleagues while on a business trip. The rooms were clean and quiet and the service was great. The hotel is located within walking distance of Safeco field and Pike's Market. They do offer free wired/wireless internet access. There is a light rail station just one block away. There is a pool and fitness center available. Like many other big city downtown hotels, there is no complimentary breakfast available. Will definitely consider this place again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Up-to-date hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: conary
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay from A-Z: The room was modern and very clean. While on the small side, it still had a couch and a coffee table in addition to the desk. Everything was in working order, the air-conditioning worked great (which was a plus during this weather in the 80's). We loved the location of the hotel. The workout room is great: It has modern life-fitness equipment with integrated (and working) TV units. There's also a pool which we didn't use. The front-desk area has a nice recreation area with couches and a couple of computers to go online. We also enjoyed the selection of drinks and snacks right next to the front desk. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would go back to this hotel any time!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again - staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: RoverReturns
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for 3rd Ave Pioneer Station for Link train for the airport - and within the yellow "free" downtown bus zone. Staff were very helpful regarding local information. I stayed for 2 nights before joining a cruise and then 4 nights afterwards. Beds very comfy, clean and quiet. Both times rooms were near the lift but they didn't cause any noise or inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “A little off the edge of downtown but nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ramblingwelove
Reviews.Content: The lobby was clean, staff was friendly, nice room. Closer to the sports venues. You can cut down your cab fare by staying there instead of downtown. However, if downtown is your destination, then you might want to stay some place closer to it. Everything a Courtyard should be. Coffee and computers in the lobby. They have a bar - beers were $3. Room was great, had a pull out sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most Courtyards, but bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is a recent re-do of a historic Seattle office building. As a result, the exterior has some architectural charm while the rooms are in good physical shape. My particular room (a king) was tiny, but the bathroom was very large (go figure) and it had very high ceilings so it didn't feel that claustrophobic. Even though I had a high floor, there was prominent street noise such as trucks and sirens. Running the A/C fan continuously helped drown out some of this, but those who demand absolute silence may find it wanting. The room had a small fridge but no microwave. The bed was very comfortable with good quality linens. The flat-screen TV had 60-ish channels of which over 50 of them were in hi-def. The wireless internet offered excellent speed, even when the hotel was full. There is the standard Courtyard Bistro restaurant that offers breakfast (OK but expensive) and light meals and a bar in the evenings. I found you could walk across the street and get a light breakfast for about half the price. The hotel is located about a block from Pioneer Square. The Pioneer Square Link Rail/Bus Tunnel station is about a block away in the other direction. The ferry terminal is about 4 blocks from the hotel. I got around without a car with no problems. Be aware that the Pioneer Square area has many homeless people coming out after business hours and panhandling is common.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review- good for singles, only ok for family”
Reviews.Author: cymbidian
Reviews.Content: on the plus side: the room was pleasant and clean, great shower, and very convenient to amtrak, lite rail, and free bus to all the touristy stuff we wanted to do. lots of great things to do and see that are less than 2 blocks away or two bus stops up the hill, nice walk back down. on the down side: the room was small for more than 2 people, daughter slept on fold out sofa, this left little room for any movement, hotel did not make up bed for her, did not include a third cup. (they don't seem prepared for families) also: there is a blinking light that flashes right over the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable but boring”
Reviews.Author: Sharktails
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell it is clean and new feeling and a good value. Overall we liked it and it met our needs but it felt like an apartment more than a hotel and had no energy to it, if that makes sense. Finally, if you stay here as for street side as the back alleyr side gets dumpster visits regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Central location between Safeco/Qwest and Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: ozzir
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night trip to Seattle and stayed at Courtyard. If you're going to a game AND wanting to spend time at Pike Place Market and/or shopping district, this is a great place to stay. The property was clean and the staff provided very good service. Here are some pros & cons: PROS - proximity to stadiums - approx 15 min walk along Occidental through Pioneer Square - rooms, room with 2 queens was a great size, was clean and comfortable - staff provided good customer service CONS - don't get a room on Cherry St side near the alley. The garbage trucks arrived between 10pm - midnight and they were very loud. - rooms generally weren't sound proof so if you like silence, you will be challenged to sleep. - $28 valet parking but I assume all hotels in downtown area would be similar. If you are going to Seattle to just go to shopping district, you should look for a hotel near that area but if you are doing that and going to a game, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it very much and will return some day!”
Reviews.Author: Mauigal2010
Reviews.Content: Rather surprised this hotel is not ranked higher because we felt this hotel was excellent for several reasons: good value (although we used points), great pub-like place for breakfast that was very good and reasonably priced, excellent location for walking to the downtown shopping area, staff were VERY helpful, cabs were always easy to get. Made dinner reservations for us to eat at Salty's and had the restaurant's limo van pick us up and return us - excellent service! One of the top 10 in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Nice, not some staff”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the hotel is great! Newly renovated and everything was shining. We had two rooms side by side and the room with the two queen beds was huge and the beds were very comfortable. The only thing I hated was the noise, we were on a lower floor and you can hear EVERYTHING from the streets. The windows would also not close all the way and you can feel the cold air coming from there. The hotel does have a very nice fitness room and indoor pool. The female staff were very nice but there were two guys at the front desk that were ignorant and not friendly. (middle aged guy with dark hair especially) They also do not provide any transportation anywhere, they told us to walk and the neighborhood had a lot of weird people and was told by others it was not safe. Overall, hotel was fine and I would probably stay again. Hopefully they'll train some of the staff better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrBob-cs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our return from Victoria, BC. Our room was large, the hotel is new, in the renovated 1904 Alaska Building. It was well located, close to the light-rail line to the airport. Having just stayed at the Marriott Victoria Inner Harbor, this was a let-down, although we paid almost the same for a room in both hotels. Maybe Seattle is more expensive for hotels. The food could be better. Not much selection for dinner or breakfast, just the basics. Some street noise because the windows don't seal out noise well.

Reviews.Title: “best priced hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: maluydiego
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience to stayed at this hotel. Nice room, with a big bathroom, great views of the city, near the market, restaurants and easy to eat places. Near the soccer stadium... clean.... nice place to stay, great services at the lobby by employees and the valet guys....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice remodeled hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromNJ2
Reviews.Content: Recently remodeled as a hotel from a former office building, with a few mid-20th century touches in the lobby. Very nice guest room with upscale bedding and amenities such as iPod player and flat screen TV with a personal welcome message. Nicely updated bathroom too. Spoke to the hotel assistant manager in the restaurant and it seemed a lot of thought went into the renovation. Some tables in the restaurant have individual flat screen TVs for personal viewing -- nice if you are a solo diner. Good location if you are there for a baseball or football game -- easy 15 minute walk. Complimentary umbrellas in the lobby to use if you encounter rainy Seattle weather. Nice, friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, New, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Wonkywave
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. Booked through Expedia after reading all of the reviews. Overall this hotel is in a good location to walk around downtown Seattle. We used the valet parking which was convienient but $28 day. The room was as advertised. It was clean and modern with a nice king bed. Staff were very good to us. We were traveling with a 1 1/2 year old and had no troubles. The bistro at the hotel was pricy but tasty. I would stay here again. I did feel the rates were a bit high though and the pool was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good service, secure storage for bags and everything looks new.”
Reviews.Author: lag746
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here at the courtyard pioneer square. When I first checked in at 10 pm, the valet was friendly and it was welcoming. I didn't ask what floor my room was because I'm on a marriott associate rate and therefore not picky about anything. I had requested a king bed and high floor room, which is exactly what I got. I was on the 13th floor (there are only 15 floors) and it was a king. Perfect! I never expect too much due to the rates that I get at Marriott's but they treated me like any other regular rate customer. As for the room, it was really nice. The walk from the elevator to the room was very close. Everything looked brand new and no smelly hotel scent. The lights were dim but I was with my boyfriend and it was a nice atmosphere. I wasn't expecting a fridge but after some looking around, there was a mini fridge in the corner hidden next to the closet. I really like fridges because whenever I go out to eat, I always come back with leftovers and it works better when I dont have to use my portable cooler. The internet is also free! There's wifi (great reception even on the 13th floor) or you can plug it in like I did. Very convenient. The desk was nice to work on and the chair is a comfortable ergonomic one. Out of all the things about this hotel, I actually felt like my luggage and valuables were secure. I never feel secure usually. The HUGE difference between this and marriott waterfront was the safety issue. I had to store my bags and laptop after I checked out at courtyard. The front desk clerk made sure my laptop was safe in the safe deposit box (you get a key and the clerk gets a key, you need both keys to open that box) and she tagged all my bags not with a cheap sticky tag, but one with a string tag. She said that the storage area is video monitored and very safe. It was behind the counter in a room where I saw management staff walking around and that's what I really liked about it. The marriott waterfront's storage is actually right at the front entrance at the valet room and everyone walking into the hotel has a full view of all the bags. It was an awful feeling knowing that a stranger could easily go in and grab something. I wasn't even able to get a safe deposit box there and I felt bad using up the front desk clerks time because there were 7 other people behind me in line at the waterfront (understaffed obviously).....anyways enough about that, that's for another review. I didn't worry one bit about my bags at courtyard. To wrap it up, I loved it here. Valet wasn't an arm and a leg and you can't beat the associate rate at this hotel. I'd love to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNerdboy
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a few nights in the heart of Seattle. It is a very nice hotel in the middle of everything. The shops around Pioneer Square are great. It was within walking distance to Pike Place Market with more great shops and restaurants. It is within walking distance to Safeco Field, which is a great ballpark. The room was pleasant and clean - what I come to expect from Marriott hotels. The price was reasonable, except the valet parking gets to be a bit expensive. Overall it was a great stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Quakertonian
Reviews.Content: Room was large and comfortable. Staff ... especially the valets ... were extremely friendly and helpful. The Bistro was not a good choice for breakfast with pre-set choices. Biggest problem we encountered was that we booked two rooms and spent two nights before going to Portland and wanted to book two more for the end of our trip but they raised the rates so high we stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the games”
Reviews.Author: ScottPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: Tired of fighting traffic and paying expensive parking fees when going to a baseball game? If so, this is the place to stay. The Courtyard is a 10 to 15 minute walk from Quest and Safeco fields. The rooms are very spacious , comfortable and clean. Our room didn't have much of a view (brick building) but it was very quiet. Staff is very friendly. Only complaint was the bar. We came in after the game and asked for Irish Coffee's. What we got was coffee with a little whisky in it. I even had to go to the bar and ask for whipped cream. Still tasted good, until I got the bill. I was surprised that the bill for three Irish Coffee's came to $34. I would definately come back to this hotel next time I come up for a game.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chessiecat
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Courtyard at Pioneer Square. I was a little worried after reading some of the previous comments, but ended up being very satisfied with our decision to stay at this location. It's conveniently located to downtown (walking distance) as well as to mass transit (which in Seattle is the way to go). There are homeless in the area but I never felt unsafe - and we have two young children. There was a little mix up the first night of our stay, but in true Marriott fashion, the problem was taken care of beyond expectation. This is why we always stay at a Marriott. We had ample time to find fault with the location as we were there for 6 nights - but found nothing to complain about. The only advice I can think of is to request a high floor or bring a sound machine. Like most city hotels, you will hear noise from cars on the street.

Reviews.Title: “nice pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrKnep
Reviews.Content: This is a conveniently located, well appointed, hotel close to all the downtown attractions. Convenient to get to the stadiums as well as the space needle using the mono-rail and free downtown buses. The hotel had an easy check-in and check-out process. They have a convenient cafe on site, but there was no room menu of items or prices which would have been helpful, as there are few open breakfast places downtown on weekends. It is a $16 cab ride to pier 91 from the hotel. Free wi-fi was an added bonus. Use AARP card for some $$ off.

Reviews.Title: “Good for downtown seattle but that's only because seattle is so expensive”
Reviews.Author: NativeCalif
Reviews.Content: No breakfast included small rooms high prices but everything else is up to good marriott standards. A few blocks from everything downtown easy to get to from the train station. Valet parking only for 28 dollars a night. Forget the rental car take the train here and stay downtown for a good price for seattle

Reviews.Title: “All around great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bwask
Reviews.Content: Living in the Seattle suburbs we don't get the chance to stay in downtown very often. Last weekend we thought we would do a weekend getaway in our own city. We booked a room at the Courtyard in Pioneer Square for Fri./Sat. nights along with some other neighbors. The property is in a historic building that was completely renovated as a hotel last year. The location was great as we could walk out the front door and walk up to the Pike Place market in about 10 minutes or a few blocks down to the Stadium where we saw the U2 concert Sat. night. The hotel management was in the lobby greeting guests when we checked in and made us feel very welcome. The rooms are done very nice and were very clean. We'll stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: mzinc0gnito
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend, flew in Friday morning, flew out Sunday evening. Decided to stay at this location because we got a good rate on the stay. Pros: - free wi-fi - clean hotel - noise level was a minimum Cons: - steep valet service $22/daily - nothing close enough for walking distance - not geared for romantic getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible vallet service, will never use them again!”
Reviews.Author: Angnjason
Reviews.Content: We had a big event in Seattle and thought we would spend the weekend, enjoying Seattle. Upon our arrival we had about an hour before we had to be at our event, just enough time to check in, change and freshin up a bit. After driving around for about 20 min looking for a place to park we decided to use their vallet service. However they were so busy that we were told that if we only wanted to have vallet park for a short time to only allow us to check in and freshin up we would have to find our own place to park, they would not park for us. Even though we were being charged for it we couldn't use it. We were extremly upset and disapointed. Unable to change and get ready for our event due to there being absolutly no parking anywhere. We only stayed the one night and traveled back home the next day. After telling the front desk about what happened we felt perhaps we should have been compted something for our trouble. We weren't and we will never stay at another Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you arrive/leave by train to/from Seattle... nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Seattle Downtown for two nights from the 31st December to the 2nd January. It is located very close to the Amtrak station and easy to find. However, it’s far from the city centre and the main tourist attractions. The front desk staff was very friendly during the check-in and gave us helpful hints about Seattle. The room had a nice view of the Puget Sound and Bainbridge Island (despite the elevated motorway just in front) and was decently decorated. We were concerned about the noise since it was New Year’s Eve but did not notice any disturbances. The breakfast was somehow strange: we had a fixed amount of money we could spend in two ways - bread or pastry or cereals + yoghurt + drink (1) or eggs or oat meal + drink (2). If we spent more than the fixed amount, we would have to pay the remainder. We didn't enjoy the system and the food was also not very tasteful. When we checked out and asked for a taxi to take us to the airport, while waiting for the taxi outside the valet guy tried to convince us to go with in his "uncle’s" car (who would charge us the same as the taxi – $40). We obviously refused and were shocked because we did not expect this to happen in a Marriott. Above all, we had a great rate since we booked well in advance and thus the hotel showed a good ratio quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Amtrak - ok otherwise but lots of street noise”
Reviews.Author: KBGA
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you are coming in from the Amtrak train. You can walk from the train in a few minutes and the area seems secure, even at night. The property is located in a historic area and is in an old former office building. Beautiful lobby and it's good to see this preserved. Security looks good, with key cards required in elevator. Rooms are tiny. Really tiny. Bathrooms are decent sized. Beds are nice. Rooms are very clean and bedding is comfey. You will hear a lot of street noise since the windows are not sound proofed. It's not bad at night until the cars and busses start going in the morning. Pool is on the chilley side but tolerable. No hot tub. Work out room looks to be well equiped. As stated in earlier posts, perks for Marriot Gold/Platimum members are minimal. Don't expect a room upgrade or breakfast coupons. If perks are important to you, this is not your hotel. In fact I was suprised to be given the smallest room in spite of Platinum status. A note to Management: premium members are attracted to some of the specials. It's a nice place to stay for location and cleanliness. But otherwise nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk staff at check-in, Lovely Front Desk staff at check out”
Reviews.Author: Happytrails444
Reviews.Content: I had booked a last minute room for myself and two friends at the Courtyard Marriott in Pioneer Square. We were staying in Seattle for the March 25th weekend. Upon arrival at the hotel late Friday (Mar 25) evening the gentleman (an undeserved label) at the front desk checked us in quite promptly and had checked us into a room on the 11th or 12th floor. I asked him what we can do for parking (the website states $26 parking available) and he quickly told me "There is no parking. You can park anywhere on the street from 6pm to 8am, after 8am it's pay parking." Being dismissed rather abruptly, I didn't question him. We took our baggage to the room which was very nice and very clean. The only problem was that it was a room with a bed and a small armchair. This indeed was not the king bed and sofa bed that I had reserved and seeing that we're three grown men, the single bed was not going to cut it. I went back to the front desk and informed him that the room was not as described. He quickly responded with a rude and short "That's all we have!" Refraining from speaking the foul language that I wanted to yell at this young man, I told him that there were three of us and I had reserved the room specifically to accommodate that. He rolled his eyes, took the keys back, and went into his secret computer of rooms. He then rudely asks, "Did you guys mess up the room." Uhhh yes, we went into the room for 30 seconds, had an all out party fest in the room, and then came quickly down the stairs and asked for a new room. The nerve of this young man was uncalled for and he was lucky i didn't jump over the desk and strangle him. This is NOT the way you would like to be treated after driving for 2.5 hours on a friday night. The stay for the most part was good, the rooms were nice and clean. We did have another mishap with staff on the saturday. One of the hotel staff (concierge or door person) was walking down the hall past our room. We asked if there were any after hours places we could check out as it was getting quite late. He was short with us and quickly says "No. You Asked an easy question, you get a quick answer." I couldn't believe how rude some of the staff were at this hotel. When we finally checked out on the friday, i took a look at the final invoice and what do you know. They charged me a $26 valet parking fee plus taxes for each night!!! This was laughable as I had to wake up each morning before 8am and move my vehicle because the Front desk guy told me there was no parking. I was fuming by this point. On a bright note, the lady who checked us out was very, very helpful. She took the parking charges off and helped us find our way to SAouthcenter which was our final destination on this trip. If we hadn't come across her, i probably would have given the service rating a one! If you book here, expect a relatively nice hotel for the price, but don't expect customer service or feeling like they'll bend over backwards because you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, could have stayed at many other better locations in SEA.”
Reviews.Author: greener_007
Reviews.Content: I chose this Marriott for its location and supposedly ‘business-friendly’ features during a recent business/leisure trip to Seattle. Overall, this hotel is just ‘okay’. If you want to stay close to Pioneer Square for the Mariners/Seahawks/Sounders, it’s probably not bad. However, I didn’t find the Courtyard concept to live up to it’s ‘business-friendly’ marketing in reality. First, it’s a historic building, so it’s not like the roadside motels you would normally associate with Marriott Courtyards. The rooms were very small. So small, my bed was less than two feet from the window. A chair facing the North wall occupied most of the width. The wardrobe/desk combination was very awkward and not ergonomically friendly. I just worked from the bed using the WiFi. I honestly felt claustrophobic in the room, something I’ve never felt before in a hotel room. I was disappointed, especially since I was entitled to a room upgrade as a Marriott rewards Gold member. The beds are comfortable, though not outstanding. The bathroom was very basic, no thrills, no additional amenities. In the elevator, the hotel had posters announcing that they now ‘proudly served Starbucks coffee’ in Courtyards. That’s great, except this one didn’t serve Starbucks, or SBC. It was the worst coffee I ever had. They have plenty of it downstairs for you, and some in your room too. It’s embarrassing to advertise something you don’t have, but by weird quirk of fate, is the closest Marriott in the world to the Starbucks global headquarters…it shouldn’t have made such a faux pas! In Seattle! Valet was troublesome. Friendly chaps, but when you arrive at night, sometimes they’re inside chatting with the staff, not outside the hotel. I had to park illegally on 1st avenue for the night and go inside and ask for the valet. Also, you have to text for your car, which costs you the hotel user some change. Granted, if you’re parking valet, you’re in for a penny, in for a pound, but a phone call on the hotel’s dime would be classier. The business center consisted of three all-in-one desktops with a proprietary Windows 7 interface. You can’t access Win 7, just a browser and the three main office programs (Word, PowerPoint, Excel). It’s awkward, and it times out at times. No tabs or multiple windows on your browser. I was in desperate need of a scanner and fax, with none to be found. Only a printer. It was a sub-par business center. Upon checkout, I told the desk that I wasn’t satisfied, and she apologized, and said I should have been offered better service and accommodations based on my loyalty membership level, and said cheerfully, ‘next time!’ There won’t be a next time for me, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: andyhg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Seattle many times and this was our first here as it's new. We liked the location, right in Pioneer Square, a short bus ride or walk up the hill to Pike Place, and best for us, a few blocks from the Amtrak station. The service in the Bistro was excellent and the food was very good. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. It's a very modern hotel, which we liked. The room was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again! We were only there one night this time, but when we go back, we hope we can stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for those that don't want central downtown.”
Reviews.Author: lilgeneral23
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Courtyard was on St Patricks Day. We wanted to near some of the Irish pubs in town and this was perfect. We were just 2 blocks from 2 different pubs and very walkable to the 3rd one at Pike Place Market. The staff here was great all around--valet & front desk. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was wonderful--as I've found with all the Marriotts I've stayed in. We were on the 9th floor and although we could still here some traffic noise it wasn't enough to keep me from sleeping. My only complaint on the room was the VERY uncomfortable sofa. The hotel is in a historic building and they've done a good job keeping some of the original marble & features of the building. I've got plans to come back in April for opening day of Baseball. It's an easy walk to both stadiums so perfect for sports event too. Probably about 10-15 minutes to Qwest Field or Safeco Field. It's also the same to get to Pike Place Market and downtown in the opposite direction.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations and staff, great food and location!”
Reviews.Author: Mycophile1
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice corner suite with a micro and fridge. We could walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go! This was a beautiful hotel and the bistro and bar were great! The staff was friendly and very helpful. The sofabed had a lot to be desired, but when we complained, they brought us a very comfortable cot. The traffic noise can sometimes be loud, but it eventually quiets down. Our entire stay was close to perfect!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC HOTEL; TERRIFIC LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: valcarcejim
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in a terrific location! Very clean, nice rooms with great service at the front! I only wish every Courtyard was as nice. Took the shuttle from the airport, which is within a block, and everything is so close and within walking distance! Loved this hotel; loved the staff. Everyone was wonderful!!! I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Completely happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanislegirl1962
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed, great room, very clean. Best of all, was the staff. From the valets to all of the desk staff ( we talked to 4 of them) all were very friendly and helpful. They helped us pick our a restaurant, even looked up to menu on line to help us decide. We choose the restaurant "Purple" and it was awesome. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished, clean, nice hotel - will stay nearer downtown next time though!”
Reviews.Author: TaysTea
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute to take my sister in law to Seattle. I didn't really research much beforehand and so just assumed this would be near the downtown code of shops and restaurants. Hotel itself is very nice, remodelled to the new style of Courtyard and clean, warm with friendly staff who make an effort to accomodate any requirements you may have (lile finding milk for our son at 10pm - very handy!). Location not the greatest. Let's just say it's a bit 'rough around the edges'. We were fine, I personally am not intimidated but some people may find the area a little too edgy for their liking. That said, it's not too far to walk to the downtown shopping core (~10 mins) and the friendly staff can help direct you ion the right direction if needs be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: Paid less than $100/night for a nice, clean, downtown hotel. It's a block from the underground station, and a block from all of the major bus routes. You do not need a car to get around downtown seattle, in fact, good luck parking. Many restaraunts and shops in the area. Pioneer Square is an edgier part of town than the Pike's Market area. Pikes Market and the Main downtown shopping area are in walking distance, but you may prefer to grab a bus or cab up to that area. Straight downhill walk, about 3 blocks to the wharf and Washington ferries to Bainbridge and Bremmerton.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Downtown, Great Value, Area's a little SKETCH.”
Reviews.Author: maarcsays
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3-night stay in Seattle. Decided to check this hotel out not only because of the reviews on here, but also because of the great value. Booked a 1 King, 2-room suite, and was not disappointed. It's a brand new hotel, in an old building. The staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Free WiFi, which is a big plus, and I like how everything is key-card access..doors and elevators, after night time. It's a good 15 minute walk to Pike Place/Westlake Downtown. Centrally located next to the light rail, and bus stops as well. Area can be a little sketchy, but coming from LA and having traveled to other sketchy cities, the bums/crackheads here aren't any trouble. Also enjoyed the free complimentary umbrellas the hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the urban traveler to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Jay_N_Thomas
Reviews.Content: I am perplexed at all the people complaining about "parking" costs at this hotel. For openers DON'T DRIVE or rent a car. There is NO parking in Seattle anyway and the new mayor is promising that all street parking will be eliminated. Traffic, especially on I-5, is a 24 hour nightmare anywhere in the city. Why bother? Seattle has a perfectly good train which takes you from the airport right to the back door of this hotel! $2.50. 30 minutes. It will take you more than 30 minutes to drive from SeaTac to downtown almost any time of the day, and money to park IF you can find a spot to park at all. Why? The public transportation system is extraordinary, and FREE all through downtown. Just hop on a bus anywhere! Walk down the hills and take the bus back up them. Queen Anne, Capitol Hill, the waterfront, Bellevue, Georgetown? The bus, train, monorail or trolly will get you there faster than driving. Okay - the hotel. The Pioneer Square bus & rail station entrance is almost underneath the hotel. Walking from the airport train, with luggage, will take 2 minutes. It's in the "old" section of Seattle so places look "old" on the outside, but there are dozens of fine restaurants within 5 or so blocks and many more very good smaller places. The hotel is a converted office building. The rooms are cozy, but pleasant and clean. Security is good. The lobby is small. There is a coffee shop directly across the street from the front door and 5 or 10 more within 2 blocks. Caution: If you are staying a Friday or Saturday night, do NOT choose a room on an upper floor. The band & party noise from the 14th & 15th floors rolls down the outside walls as if all the windows were open. Stay BELOW the 10th floor. It's an old building. The lower floors have more traffic noise, but there is little traffic in that part of Seattle in the mornings on the weekends. Check your room after housekeeping leaves. Housekeeping's sketchy occasionally. You might find there are no drinking glasses, or the coffee perc wasn't refreshed, or, you might be missing soap or shampoo. Just careless, but on the flip side, the front office staff will bend over backwards to accommodate you. I didn't try the attached cafe. Overall, it's a Courtyard. It is its location which makes it special.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: PuraAula
Reviews.Content: GOOD: I read ALL posts before making the reservation and was skeptical. But I was pleasantly surprised with everything of this fantastic hotel. It is more like Renaissance chain than typical Courtyard all around the country. I was upgraded to a studio as soon as I requested for one. Rooms are be little bit smaller than most (typical) Courtyards hotels. But the they are beautifully decorated, the drapes, curtains were class of its own. All rooms are absolutely sound proof from its surrounding room, which itself is something unheard of any other Courtyard. Receptionist was really nice. I needed little bit of milk to make my tea...I went to the Starbucks within hotel. Although it was closed a guy came out the kitchen, open the closed refrig. and simply gave me small container of milk for free !!! Most striking was the service I got from the valet parking. They greeted us with smile, carried our luggage, opened both the car doors, brought the car within seconds with heater on. Simply out standing. And the charges were far less than anyone else in the downtown area. Overall, I think they are the best Courtyard in the country - I have stayed in 22 different ones all over the states. Location was outstanding....forget what other say about high hill walk. You are in downtown Seattle....its all the same up & down toward the water. BTW, it was a very pleasant short walk. BAD: The noise from a neighboring bar on Saturday night. Our room was all glass with spectacular view but that caught up with the noise from the street.. It is nothing to do with the hotel just the fact that there is a bar next door and that can get rowdy on weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia
Reviews.Content: This is a very new Courtyard Marriott located just south of Pioneer Square so you are about 6-8 blocks away from the central downtown core (but half a block from Pioneer Square transit station). Pros: modern well equipped rooms, free wifi, great service, decent breakfast in hotel restaurant, great value compared to nearby hotels. Rooms on front of the hotel on high floors have a fabulous unobstructed view of the Seattle harbor. Has an indoor pool in the basement but it is very small. Parking is valet only at $26 but there are much cheaper lots close by. Rooms on front of hotel on low floors may be noisy. Overall a very nice hotel and a great value ... will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeTulsa_OK
Reviews.Content: We were schedule to stay for two nights at the end of October 2010. Due to airplane delays we were there only one night. The cancellation of the first night was taken care of quickly and professionally. When we did finally arrive the staff was very courteous and helpful. We loved our room. It had a King Bed and a sofa bed. The furniture was very nice and nice decor. We walked there from the Pioneer Square station. Luckily it was all downhill and we did not have to walk back that way when we left. After our arrival we immediatley walked to Smith Tower for the view of the city from their observation deck. The builiding itself was nice to view and enjoyed the old style elevator. The view was outstanding. After that we walked to Pike Place Market. It was a gradual up hill walk but was not too difficult. After visiting Pike Place Market we walked further north for a while. On our way back we stopped for dinner and then went to a small bar close to the hotel. I would definitely come here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: ostyle
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights during a short weekend trip to Seattle. Although the hotel was very nice and the rooms were great, I was disappointed that we were placed on a low floor with a view of the back alley, right next to the hallway ice machine (which was pretty loud when people used it). I would probably stay here again because it's good value and the location is very convenient (a block away from the light rail station that goes directly to SeaTac Airport). Service was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with a couple of warnings”
Reviews.Author: Garyverde
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to this hotel by positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We had a nice 3 night stay but there are some issues that should be considered. First, the positives: The Marriott people have done a great job of renovating this classic building. The style is restrained and classic. They have 5 computers in the lobby for guest use, plus free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The staff is friendly and efficient. Problems? The rooms are very small; really more like cabins on a cruise ship. Our friends had a room slightly larger than ours but still small. There is no garage so the valet parkers use a garage down the street. Including the Seattle parking tax, the cost is over $30 per day. Another thing to consider: It's a good 20 minute walk to the edge of the downtown area. While the Pioneer Square area is somewhat interesting, there aren't many good restaurants and "street people" can be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for a superior class hotel at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: mahiwahoo
Reviews.Content: Tastefully furnished, although, the carpet is abit loud and busy on the eye! Despite that Courtyard Seattle is an impressive hotel well located in Pioneer Square and close enough to downtown attractions. Good value for money and above par compared to other Seattle hotels we've stayed at. Only stayed a couple of nights, wanted to stay longer, but, hotel was fully booked. During our stay, there were major street repairs and construction so abit noisy in our room during the day. But can't fault the hotel for that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and New Hotel, Easy to Navigate City”
Reviews.Author: purplejenn11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Sept 2010. Like others have said, it was easy to get to from the airport via the light rail ($2.50). Also, all buses in downtown area are free. We were able to walk to several restaurants, Pike's Market, the water, etc. We walked to the downtown shopping area as well, but it was a bit more of a hike. The area felt very safe during the day, but it was pretty empty at night (seems like more of a worker area). The room was nice, although small. The Bistro was great for a snack or drink. The service was great. In all, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. New. Hip. Possibly Noisy. Neighborhood Sketchy for Female Traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new Courtyard and the condition of the hotel is excellent -- nice flat screen television with many channels, very comfortable beds with nice linens, very friendly, helpful staff, three computers and a printer in the lobby and the location is one block from the Pioneer Square Light Rail to Sea-Tac Airport. In general, this is a nice modern "hip" property. I think Courtyard is targeting a younger customer rather than baby boomers with the new design. I found some of the furniture not so comfortable for sitting. I did not care for the blue/brown themed retro decor or the individual pod check-in desks. Plus, the male employees wore "Star Trek" uniforms. One employee even jokingly asked me how I liked the Star Trek look. The Pioneer Square location is off the beaten path from shopping and restaurant areas but close to the stadiums. The hotel is located one block west of Pioneer Square Park on the "good" side. The area could be a little sketchy after dark especially for a female solo traveler. Just be alert. During the day the neighborhood was fine and populated with business office occupants. The Pioneer Square Park population consisted of drunks, homeless and some dubious looking characters but no one bothered me. The rail station was up a steep hill. The walk was a little workout with a suitcase in tow but doable. The main Pioneer Square station entrance had escalators going both ways. The James Street entrance had only one escalator ..... up to the street from the rail. My first room #804 was noisy due to its location in the historic front side of the hotel facing 2nd Avenue. Rm. #804 was a King room with a sofa bed and was on the small side with a coffee table and hassock in the middle of the room taking up space. This room was noisy due to general street traffic out front. I heard every car and truck drive by. I live in Manhattan on a busy corner. I experience urban noise everyday and found this room noisy. This Courtyard needs to sound proof the hotel windows on the front of the building. Rachel, at the front desk, offered a quieter room in the back of the building. I took up the offer. Since I was there only one night, I was upgraded to Studio Room #1020 in the back of the "newer" building. Much better, spacious and very quiet. Rooms above the eighth floor in the back of the building have an open view facing the office building area. I was very satisfied by the remedy and promptness of service by the front desk at 10PM. The Bistro restaurant had a nice crowd, decent food selection, especially for breakfast, and newspapers. At night, The Bistro was a practical feature because there was not much nearby. The fitness room was very nice and a good size with all new equipment. The property was very clean and tidy and the staff was enthusiastic. This Courtyard worked for my one night stopover and its convenience to the Sea-Tac Airport light rail station. For a longer stay, I would choose a property closer to the shopping and market area so I could walk around in the evening by myself and feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's really a Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTraveler4020
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Marriott recently renovated the old Alaska Building in Pioneer Square and turned it into the most upscale Courtyard we have ever seen. Loved our room! It's a little on the small side but really comfortable and neatly decorated. The location is perfect. We rode the Light Rail in from SeaTac and it is just a short walk from the Pioneer Square station to this hotel. No need for a rental car ---- which is a good thing because parking is a nightmare in downtown Seattle!!! The Waterfront & Pike's Market is only a few blocks away. It's an easy walk to Westlake Center where you can take the Monorail to Settle Center & the Space Needle. We had breakfast in the little cafe/bistro in the lobby -- simple but good food and of course, Starbucks coffee! Really friendly & helpful staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Son_of_a_Sailor_51
Reviews.Content: Stayed using points, and was amazed at the overall excellence of the Staff. From the Valet guys, to the front desk folks, we were treated with nothing but postive and friendly attitudes. The room was fully furnished with a small kitchen area, with all the utensils. (We did use the forks and plates to split a decadent cheesecake we purchased during the day.) We were close to our destination of Qwest Field (Go Packers), and Pioneer Square. Another wonderful Courtyard Stay. Thanks again to a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missbiggun
